author: Amarnath Tewary
text:
A Bihar student on Saturday claimed that he had received a phone call from Islamabad attempting to lure him to join the Pakistani intelligence agency Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI). The “frightened” youth has filed a complaint with the police.

According to police, Mukesh Kumar (18), a Class XII student in Bhabua district, received the call on Friday morning that offered him a handsome amount if he joins the ISI.

Police said Mukesh Kumar refused to accept the offer. Asked if the offer was to join the ISI or the terror outfit Islamic State (IS) that also goes by the acronym ISIS, police said the youth looked “frightened” and was not sure “whether it was ISIS or ISI.”

Mukesh’s friends traced the call through a call tracker app to discover that it came from Islamabad.
title: Bihar student claims call from Pakistan’s ISI
